pr_title: Remove LS steps from the stack getting started

timeline.message: Remove LS steps from the stack getting started

timeline.bodyText:
On line 4:

Looking for an {stack} ("ELK") guide that shows how to quickly install and configure the {stack}? You're in the right place! You can install the {stack} on a single VM, or even on your laptop:

Do we still want to call this an ELK guide if the L is excluded?
timeline.author: bmorelli25
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,10 +6,14 @@ Looking for an {stack} ("ELK") guide that shows how to quickly install and confi
 * <<install-elasticsearch,{es}>>

replies.bodyText:
I think we do. I know it seems odd, but lots of users still search on "ELK" when they're first getting started. So here's the backstory:
Originally I used "ELK tutorial" in the opening paragraph of this topic because forum users kept searching on "ELK tutorial" and finding a topic on the Digital Ocean website that recommended old Beats settings. These settings were causing major problems. Adding "ELK tutorial" pushed us up quite a bit in the rankings.
It looks like @szabosteve removed "tutorial" from the topic, but that might be OK because the Digital Ocean tutorial isn't completely broken now.
replies.author: dedemorton

replies.bodyText:
@dedemorton
Yes, it was me back in the DEVO days. Our working group dealt with Getting started/Tutorial/Quickstart definitions and content. As part of that effort, we tried to streamline the wording of the respective pieces. Sometimes it was just to remove a word that defines the function of the piece, like here. I wasn't aware that time the reasoning behind calling it a tutorial or that you are the author of this piece, DeDe, that's why I didn't ask you about it. Sorry for the inconvenience and thanks for the heads-up!
replies.author: szabosteve

replies.bodyText: @szabosteve Yah that makes sense. In this case, I probably should have added a comment to the file to explain why I was doing something that was a little non-standard. :-) I think it makes sense to retain "ELK" here for now...especially since we will be replacing this GS at some point soonish.
replies.author: dedemorton
